author: barnabasbusa
content:
I'm asking all EL devs again (except nethermind) to remove named forks from "Blob_schedule" fields and only have explicit BPO values in there. 
Its probably too late to yeet osaka (even tho its a redundant field already), but having to have amsterdam/bogota/istanbul in the blob schedule fields in the genesis.json together with all the possible combinations of different BPO values is gonna make configuring a network config weirdly complex for no actual benefit. 
The CL already cannot change the blob values at named fork boundaries, as they have removed the max_blobs_per_block_fulu/target_blobs_per_block_fulu fields. The only place where such change can be done is via the blob_schedule array. (which might or might not be the same as the fulu fork epoch.)

So I'm asking once again, not to have the requirement to add future named EL forks in the blob schedule field as it is a field that will be redundant, and just make it super prone to have a mistake. 

Complex scenarios that are prone to having issues:

imagine a base network that has went through osaka/bpo1 but not bpo2, and you want to have a shadowfork where you want to trigger amsterdam, but want to unschedule bpo2 first, as you don't want to test blob schedule change.

content: I think this is also a question for <@539495253418180618>. Do we categorically prohibit named forks from changing the blob schedule?

author: barnabasbusa
content:
I'm not saying we should ban this behaviour, I'm saying that we don't have the fields on the CL side to do these changes anymore. 

We can still schedule a BPO on the same epoch/timestamp and achieve the same result, but it can't be under the named fork, but rather under the BPO name fields
